text: In this regard , the inhibitors of DNA binding proteins ( Ids ) are considered to be some of the major target genes for Smad - signalling [ 17 ] .

Thus , B cells were pre-incubated over night in X-VIVO 15 , and then cultured in medium alone or in the presence of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for various time points before preparation of total RNA .
The amount of <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> Id4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was quantified by real-time RT-PCR .

Interestingly , we observed a specific four-fold upregulation of <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - treated B cells ( Figure 7 ) .

text: The up-regulation of <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was characteristic of an early inducible gene , with maximal upregulation two hours after the addition of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and returned to baseline after 24 hours .

text: In contrast , no significant changes were observed for <extra_id_0> Id2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , whereas <extra_id_0> Id4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - transcripts were not detectable ( Figure 7 , data not shown ) .

Western blot analysis revealed that the <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced upregulation of <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA also was correlated with upregulation of <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein as well .

text: The increase in <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein level was detectable after one hour and increased until 24 hours after <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> addition , showing a 16-fold upregulation compared with t0 ( p < = 0.020 , n = 4 ) ( Figure 8 and 9 ) .

text: We were able to block the <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> specific band with a blocking peptide ( data not shown ) .

Taken together , these data suggest that <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could be a possible target gene for mediating the effects of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human B cells , whereas <extra_id_0> Id2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Id3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> not seem to be involved .
